title: In Syria, women's distrust of the new government
summary: The messages of moderation conveyed by Ahmed al-Sharaa, the former jihadist turned powerbroker in Damascus, have failed to reassure Syrian women, particularly those from minority communities.

title: Pelicot rape trial: 17 defendants appeal verdict but not ex-husband, appeal trial to be held in 2025
summary: Dominique Pelicot, the main defendant among 51 men convicted in a mass rape trial, will not appeal his 20-year prison sentence for having drugged and raped his then-wife and soliciting many other men to do the same, according to his lawyer.

title: Trump camp splits as Musk and MAGA base feud on tech visas
summary: The president-elect's most fiercely anti-immigration followers have railed against pro-Trump Silicon Valley billionaires – including Elon Musk – for promoting H-1B visas, which allow foreign engineers to come to the US.

title: Serbian court convicts parents of teenager who killed 10 in school attack
summary: The shooter was 13 years old when he committed the crime and therefore too young to face a trial, according to Serbian law. His parents were detained soon after the shooting and charged with failing to keep the weapons out of reach of their son.

title: Jeju Air crash: South Korean government orders check of country's Boeing 737-800s
summary: The South Korean low-cost carrier's crashed aircraft, which entered service in 2009 and was purchased from Ryanair in 2016, was relatively new by international aviation standards.

title: Le Monde's favorite albums of 2024
summary: Kendrick Lamar, Lucile Boulanger, Fontaines D.C., Kenny Barron, MGMT... Here are the favorite records of Le Monde's music critics in 2024.

title: Federal appeals court upholds sexual abuse verdict against Trump
summary: Trump had contested the $5 million civil verdict, arguing that the trial judge had committed multiple errors, including permitting testimony from two other women who alleged that Trump had sexually assaulted them. The appeals court ruled that the judge had not abused his discretion in handling the evidence.

title: Cybersecurity: US Treasury says it was targeted by China-backed cyberattack
summary: The incident has been attributed to a China state-sponsored Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) actor." This is not the first time the US or some of its allies, has blamed China for orchestrating such actions.

title: Inside the secret prisons of former Bangladesh leader Sheikh Hasina
summary: After the fall of the autocratic leader on August 5, survivors of the regime's prison system resurfaced, and the interim government of Muhammad Yunus set up a commission to investigate enforced disappearances and extrajudicial killings.

title: Israel army declares it intercepted a missile fired from Yemen
summary: In recent weeks, Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels have claimed to have fired several missiles at Israel, triggering retaliatory strikes from Jerusalem targeting the rebels' strategic assets and infrastructure.

title: Paris casinos, collateral victims of France's budget stalemate, due to close on Tuesday
summary: These establishments were authorized as part of a three-year experiment to clean up gambling in the Paris region. In the absence of a budget bill to extend this authorization, they are forced to close on December 31 and furlough workers.

title: French PM Bayrou presents recovery plan during visit to cyclone-struck Mayotte
summary: Arriving in the French overseas department, which suffered the ravages of Cyclone Chido, Prime Minister François Bayrou said the recovery plan aims to rebuild the archipelago within two years.

title: Jimmy Carter was a tireless fighter against disease and for women's rights
summary: At the end of his term of office, the former US president launched the Carter Center in 1982, a foundation with far-reaching philanthropic ambitions. He died on December 29, aged 100.

title: Biden announces $2.5 billion military aid package for Ukraine
summary: Joe Biden's administration is racing to send Ukraine arms before Donald Trump's inauguration on January 20.

title: Trump endorses Mike Johnson to stay on as US House speaker
summary: The election for the speaker of the House takes place Friday.

title: Camille Fourmont, La Buvette's visionary restaurateur in eastern Paris
summary: In just a few years, this self-taught talent has become a leading figure in the bistronomy scene in eastern Paris, with her wine bar. Fourmont, who recently opened another spot for cheese lovers, is also a decorator, culinary identity creator and ceramicist in her spare time.

title: New York from the window of a cab
summary: To pay for his photography studies, Joseph Rodríguez criss-crossed New York in a rented cab from 1977 to 1987. From his vehicle, he captured street scenes and portrayed his passengers: partygoers leaving nightclubs or small families in their Sunday best. The Fotomuseum in Maastricht, the Netherlands, is devoting a retrospective to his career.

title: Syria's new leader al-Sharaa insists on taking time for 'national dialogue' before elections
summary: In his first interview with an Arab media outlet, Ahmed al-Sharaa, the head of the armed group HTS said it would be four years before elections were held in Syria. He also reached out to Iran and Russia, the former allies of ex-dictator Bashar al-Assad.

title: From Bottega Veneta to Chanel, fashion reshuffles top talents amid economic storm
summary: Matthieu Blazy's appointment as Chanel's artistic director on December 12 ended the suspense that had the fashion world holding its breath. It was the high point of a transfer market that had been shaking up luxury fashion houses for months. This frantic waltz of designers reflects the difficulties of a sector faced with a significant drop in sales.
